key_risks: Market Competition: High competition in the electric motorcycle market.
Supply Chain Vulnerabilities: Disruptions in supply chain for critical components.
Consumer Adoption Challenges: Hesitancy around electric motorcycles due to range and cost concerns.
Regulatory Uncertainty: Evolving regulations on emissions and safety standards.
Financial Performance: Current financial losses and reliance on Harley-Davidson.
controversies: SPAC Merger and Public Listing: Volatility in stock performance post-SPAC merger.
Parent Company Dependency: Reliance on Harley-Davidson for corporate services.
environmental_issues: Sustainability Initiatives: Commitment to reducing carbon footprint and using eco-friendly materials.
social_issues: Consumer Adoption Challenges: Concerns about range, charging infrastructure, and higher upfront costs.
governance_issues: Parent Company Dependency: Potential limitations on operational autonomy due to reliance on Harley-Davidson.

sources.title: LiveWire (company) - Wikipedia
sources.snippet: LiveWire is an American electric motorcycle manufacturer. It was initially launched as a dedicated electric vehicle (EV) division for Harley Davidson in July 2021. The company was spun-off from its parent and went public on September 27, 2022, via merger with a special-purpose acquisition company (SPAC). [3] [4] It was the first publicly traded electric motorcycle company in the United States.
